  9#ifndef VSIP_CORE_EXPR_FNS_ELEMENTWISE_HPP
 10#define VSIP_CORE_EXPR_FNS_ELEMENTWISE_HPP
 11
 12#include <vsip/core/expr/functor.hpp>
 13#include <vsip/core/promote.hpp>
 14#include <vsip/core/fns_scalar.hpp>
 15#include <vsip/core/metaprogramming.hpp>
 16#include <vsip/core/lvalue_proxy.hpp>
 17
 18/// Macro to define a unary function on views in terms of
 19/// its homologe on scalars.
 20#define VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_FUNCTOR(f, F)					  \
 21namespace vsip_csl { namespace expr { namespace op {                      \
 22template <typename T>                                                     \
 23struct F                                                                  \
 24{                                                                         \
 25  typedef T result_type;                                                  \
 26  static char const *name() { return #f;}                                 \
 27  static result_type apply(T t) { return fn::f(t);}                       \
 28  result_type operator()(T t) const { return apply(t);}                   \
 29};                                                                        \
 30}}}
 31
 32#define VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_FUNCTOR_RETN(f, F, retn)			  \
 33namespace vsip_csl { namespace expr { namespace op {                      \
 34template <typename T>                                                     \
 35struct F                                                                  \
 36{                                                                         \
 37  typedef retn result_type;                                               \
 38  static char const *name() { return #f;}                                 \
 39  static result_type apply(T t) { return fn::f(t);}                       \
 40  result_type operator()(T t) const { return apply(t);}                   \
 41};                                                                        \
 42}}}
 43
 44#define VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_DISPATCH(f, F)	  				  \
 45namespace vsip { namespace impl {                                         \
 46template <typename T>                                                     \
 47struct Dispatch_##f :                                                     \
 48  conditional<Is_view_type<T>::value,				          \
 49    Unary_func_view<vsip_csl::expr::op::F, T>,	                          \
 50    typename conditional<Is_lvalue_proxy_type<T>::value,		  \
 51      expr::op::F<typename Is_lvalue_proxy_type<T>::value_type>,          \
 52      expr::op::F<T> >::type>::type      		                  \
 53{};                                                                       \
 54}}
 55
 56#define VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_FUNCTION(f, F)		 			  \
 57namespace vsip {                                                          \
 58template <typename T>                                                     \
 59inline                                                                    \
 60typename impl::Dispatch_##f<T>::result_type	                          \
 61f(T const& t)							          \
 62{ return impl::Dispatch_##f<T>::apply(t);}				  \
 63}
 64
 65/// This function gateway is roughly specialized to VSIPL++ view types.
 66/// This prevents it from competing with more general function overloads.
 67/// For example, cmath defines template <typename T> bool isnan(T& t)
 68/// which is ambiguous with the normal VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_FUNCTION.
 69#define VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_VIEW_FUNCTION(f)				  \
 70namespace vsip {                                                          \
 71template <template <typename, typename> class V,                          \
 72          typename T, typename B>                                         \
 73inline                                                                    \
 74typename impl::Dispatch_##f<V<T,B> >::result_type			  \
 75f(V<T,B> const &t)							  \
 76{ return impl::Dispatch_##f<V<T,B> >::apply(t);}			  \
 77}
 78
 79#define VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_FUNC(f, F)					  \
 80VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_FUNCTOR(f, F)						  \
 81VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_DISPATCH(f, F)						  \
 82VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_FUNCTION(f, F)
 83
 84
 85#define VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_FUNC_RETN(f, F, retn)				  \
 86VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_FUNCTOR_RETN(f, F, retn)				  \
 87VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_DISPATCH(f, F)						  \
 88VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_FUNCTION(f, F)
 89
 90#define VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_VIEW_FUNC_RETN(f, F, retn)			  \
 91VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_FUNCTOR_RETN(f, F, retn)				  \
 92VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_DISPATCH(f, F)						  \
 93VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_VIEW_FUNCTION(f)
 94
 95/// Define a unary operator. Assume the associated Dispatch 
 96/// is already defined.
 97#define VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_OP(op, fname)                                     \
 98namespace vsip { namespace impl {                                         \
 99template <typename T>                                                     \
100typename Dispatch_##fname<typename Is_view_type<T>::type>::result_type    \
101operator op(T t)                                                          \
102{ return Dispatch_##fname<T>::apply(t);}                                  \
103}}
104
105/// Macro to define a binary function on views in terms of
106/// its homologe on scalars.
107#define VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_FUNCTOR(f, F)					  \
108namespace vsip_csl { namespace expr { namespace op {                      \
109template <typename T1, typename T2>                                       \
110struct F                                                                  \
111{                                                                         \
112  typedef typename Promotion<T1, T2>::type result_type;                   \
113  static char const *name() { return #f;}                                 \
114  static result_type apply(T1 t1, T2 t2) { return fn::f(t1, t2);}         \
115  result_type operator()(T1 t1, T2 t2) const { return apply(t1, t2);}     \
116};                                                                        \
117}}}
118
119#define VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_FUNCTOR_RETN(f, F, retn)			  \
120namespace vsip_csl { namespace expr { namespace op {                      \
121template <typename T1, typename T2>                                       \
122struct F                                                                  \
123{                                                                         \
124  typedef retn result_type;                                               \
125  static char const *name() { return #f;}                                 \
126  static result_type apply(T1 t1, T2 t2) { return fn::f(t1, t2);}         \
127  result_type operator()(T1 t1, T2 t2) const { return apply(t1, t2);}     \
128};                                                                        \
129}}}
130
131#define VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_FUNCTOR_SCALAR_RETN(f, F)	 	 	  \
132namespace vsip_csl { namespace expr { namespace op {                      \
133template <typename T1, typename T2>                                       \
134struct F                                                                  \
135{                                                                         \
136  typedef typename impl::Scalar_of<typename Promotion<T1, T2>::type>::type\
137                result_type;                                              \
138  static char const *name() { return #f;}                                 \
139  static result_type apply(T1 t1, T2 t2) { return fn::f(t1, t2);}         \
140  result_type operator()(T1 t1, T2 t2) const { return apply(t1, t2);}     \
141};                                                                        \
142}}}
143
144#define VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_DISPATCH(f, F)					  \
145namespace vsip { namespace impl {                                         \
146template <typename T1, typename T2>                                       \
147struct Dispatch_##f :                                                     \
148  conditional<Is_view_type<T1>::value || Is_view_type<T2>::value,         \
149              Binary_func_view<expr::op::F, T1, T2>,		          \
150	      expr::op::F<T1, T2> >::type			          \
151{};  									  \
152}}
153
154/// Define a dispatcher that only matches if at least one of the arguments
155/// is a view type.
156#define VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OP_DISPATCH(f, F)				  \
157namespace vsip { namespace impl {                                         \
158template <typename T1, typename T2,                                       \
159          bool P = Is_view_type<T1>::value || Is_view_type<T2>::value>    \
160struct Dispatch_op_##f : Binary_func_view<expr::op::F, T1, T2> {};        \
161template <typename T1, typename T2>                                       \
162struct Dispatch_op_##f<T1, T2, false> {};                                 \
163}}
164
165#define VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_FUNCTION(f)	  			 	  \
166namespace vsip {                                                          \
167template <typename T1, typename T2>                                       \
168inline                                                                    \
169typename impl::Dispatch_##f<T1, T2>::result_type			  \
170f(T1 const &t1, T2 const &t2)					          \
171{ return impl::Dispatch_##f<T1, T2>::apply(t1, t2);}                      \
172}
173
174#define VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPERATOR_ONE(op, fname)                          \
175namespace vsip {                                                          \
176template <typename T1, typename T2>                                       \
177inline                                                                    \
178typename impl::Dispatch_op_##fname<T1, T2>::result_type		          \
179operator op(T1 const& t1, T2 const& t2)					  \
180{ return impl::Dispatch_op_##fname<T1, T2>::apply(t1, t2);}		  \
181}
182
183#define VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPERATOR_TWO(op, fname)                          \
184namespace vsip {                                                          \
185template <template <typename, typename> class View,                       \
186          typename T1, typename Block1, typename T2>                      \
187inline                                                                    \
188typename impl::Dispatch_op_##fname<View<T1, Block1>, T2>::result_type	  \
189operator op(View<T1, Block1> const& t1, T2 t2)				  \
190{ return impl::Dispatch_op_##fname<View<T1, Block1>, T2>::apply(t1, t2);} \
191                                                                          \
192template <template <typename, typename> class View,                       \
193          typename T1, typename T2, typename Block2>                      \
194inline                                                                    \
195typename impl::Dispatch_op_##fname<T1, View<T2, Block2> >::result_type	  \
196operator op(T1 t1, View<T2, Block2> const& t2)				  \
197{ return impl::Dispatch_op_##fname<T1, View<T2, Block2> >::apply(t1, t2);}\
198                                                                          \
199template <template <typename, typename> class LView,                      \
200          template <typename, typename> class RView,                      \
201          typename T1, typename Block1,                                   \
202          typename T2, typename Block2>                                   \
203inline                                                                    \
204typename impl::Dispatch_op_##fname<LView<T1, Block1>,			  \
205                             RView<T2, Block2> >::result_type             \
206operator op(LView<T1, Block1> const& t1, RView<T2, Block2> const& t2)	  \
207{ return impl::Dispatch_op_##fname<LView<T1, Block1>,			  \
208                             RView<T2, Block2> >::apply(t1, t2);}         \
209}
210
211#if (defined(__GNUC__) && __GNUC__ < 4) || defined(__ghs__) || defined(__ICL)
212# define VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPERATOR(op, fname)                             \
213VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPERATOR_ONE(op, fname)
214#else
215# define VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPERATOR(op, fname)                             \
216VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPERATOR_TWO(op, fname)
217#endif
218
219
220#define VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_VIEW_FUNCTION(f) 	 	 	 	  \
221namespace vsip {                                                          \
222template <template <typename, typename> class V,                          \
223          typename T, typename B>                                         \
224inline                                                                    \
225typename impl::Dispatch_##f<V<T,B>, V<T,B> >::result_type		  \
226f(V<T,B> const &t1, V<T,B> const &t2)				          \
227{ return impl::Dispatch_##f<V<T,B>, V<T,B> >::apply(t1, t2);}             \
228}
229
230#define VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_FUNC(f, F)	 			  	  \
231VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_FUNCTOR(f, F)					          \
232VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_DISPATCH(f, F)					          \
233VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_FUNCTION(f)				                  \
234VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_VIEW_FUNCTION(f)
235
236/// Binary function that map to binary operators. For those the functor
237/// already exists.
238#define VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_FUNC_USEOP(f, F)			          \
239VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_DISPATCH(f, F) 				          \
240VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_FUNCTION(f)	    		 	                  \
241VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_VIEW_FUNCTION(f)
242
243#define VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_FUNC_RETN(f, F, retn)				  \
244VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_FUNCTOR_RETN(f, F, retn)				  \
245VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_DISPATCH(f, F)					          \
246VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_FUNCTION(f)
247
248#define VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_FUNC_SCALAR_RETN(f, F)				  \
249VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_FUNCTOR_SCALAR_RETN(f, F)				  \
250VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_DISPATCH(f, F)					          \
251VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_FUNCTION(f)
252
253#define VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OP(op, f, F)					  \
254VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OP_DISPATCH(f, F)				          \
255VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OPERATOR(op, f)
256
257/// Macro to define a ternary function on views in terms of
258/// its homologe on scalars.
259#define VSIP_IMPL_TERNARY_FUNC(f, F)	 				  \
260namespace vsip_csl { namespace expr { namespace op {                      \
261template <typename T1, typename T2, typename T3>                          \
262struct F                                                                  \
263{                                                                         \
264  typedef typename Promotion<typename Promotion<T1, T2>::type,            \
265                             T3>::type result_type;                       \
266  static char const *name() { return #f;}                                 \
267  static result_type apply(T1 t1, T2 t2, T3 t3)                           \
268  { return fn::f(t1, t2, t3);}                                            \
269  result_type operator()(T1 t1, T2 t2, T3 t3) const                       \
270  { return apply(t1, t2, t3);}                                            \
271};                                                                        \
272}}}                                                                       \
273namespace vsip { namespace impl {				          \
274template <typename T1, typename T2, typename T3>                          \
275struct Dispatch_##f :                                                     \
276  conditional<Is_view_type<T1>::value ||                                  \
277           Is_view_type<T2>::value ||                                     \
278           Is_view_type<T3>::value,                                       \
279           Ternary_func_view<expr::op::F, T1, T2, T3>,	                  \
280           expr::op::F<T1, T2, T3> >::type		                  \
281{};                                                                       \
282} 								 	  \
283template <typename T1, typename T2, typename T3>                          \
284inline									  \
285typename impl::Dispatch_##f<T1, T2, T3>::result_type		          \
286f(T1 const &t1, T2 const &t2, T3 const &t3)				  \
287{ return impl::Dispatch_##f<T1, T2, T3>::apply(t1, t2, t3);}              \
288}
289
290/***********************************************************************
291  Unary Functions
292***********************************************************************/
293
294VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_FUNC(acos, Acos)

296namespace vsip_csl { namespace expr { namespace op {
297template <typename T> struct Arg {};
298
299template <typename T>
300struct Arg<std::complex<T> >
301{
302  typedef T result_type;
303  static char const *name() { return "arg"; }                
304  static result_type apply(std::complex<T> t) { return fn::arg(t);}
305  result_type operator()(std::complex<T> t) const { return apply(t);}
306};
307}}}
308
309VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_DISPATCH(arg, Arg)
310VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_FUNCTION(arg, Arg)

320namespace vsip_csl { namespace expr { namespace op {
321template <typename T>
322struct Euler
323{
324  typedef std::complex<T> result_type;
325  static char const *name() { return "euler"; }                
326  static result_type apply(T t) { return fn::euler(t);}
327  result_type operator()(T t) const { return apply(t);}
328};
329}}}

332VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_FUNCTION(euler, Euler)

341template <typename T>
342struct Imag<std::complex<T> >
343{
344  typedef T result_type;
345  static char const *name() { return "imag"; }
346  static result_type apply(std::complex<T> t) { return fn::imag(t);}
347  result_type operator()(std::complex<T> t) const { return apply(t);}
348};
349}}}

369template <typename T>
370struct Real<std::complex<T> >
371{
372  typedef T result_type;
373  static char const *name() { return "real"; }                
374  static result_type apply(std::complex<T> t) { return fn::real(t);}
375  result_type operator()(std::complex<T> t) const { return apply(t);}
376};
377}}}

393namespace vsip_csl { namespace expr { namespace op {
394template <typename T>
395struct Impl_real
396{
397  typedef typename impl::Scalar_of<T>::type result_type;
398  static char const *name() { return "impl_real";}
399  static result_type apply(T t) { return fn::impl_real(t);}
400  result_type operator()(T t) const { return apply(t);}
401};
402}}}
403
404VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_DISPATCH(impl_real, Impl_real)
405VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_FUNCTION(impl_real, Impl_real)

408template <typename T>
409struct Impl_imag

411  typedef typename impl::Scalar_of<T>::type result_type;
412  static char const *name() { return "impl_imag";}
413  static result_type apply(T t) { return fn::impl_imag(t);}
414  result_type operator()(T t) const { return apply(t);}
415};
416}}}

421namespace vsip_csl { namespace expr { namespace op {
422// This unary operator gives a hint to the compiler that this block is
423// unaligned
424template <typename T>
425struct Unaligned
426{
427  typedef T result_type;
428  static char const *name() { return "unaligned"; }                
429  static result_type apply(T t) { return t;}
430  result_type operator()(T t) const { return apply(t);}
431};
432}}}
433
434VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_DISPATCH(unaligned, Unaligned)
435VSIP_IMPL_UNARY_FUNCTION(unaligned, Unaligned)

502namespace vsip_csl { namespace expr { namespace op {
503template <typename T1, typename T2>
504struct Bxor_or_lxor
505{
506  typedef typename Promotion<T1, T2>::type result_type;
507  static char const *name() { return "bxor";}
508  static result_type apply(T1 t1, T2 t2) { return fn::bxor(t1, t2);}
509  result_type operator()(T1 t1, T2 t2) const { return apply(t1, t2);}
510};
511
512template <>
513struct Bxor_or_lxor<bool, bool>
514{
515  typedef bool result_type;
516  static char const *name() { return "lxor";}
517  static result_type apply(bool t1, bool t2) { return fn::lxor(t1, t2);}
518  result_type operator()(bool t1, bool t2) const { return apply(t1, t2);}
519};
520}}}
521
522VSIP_IMPL_BINARY_OP(^, bxor_or_lxor, Bxor_or_lxor)
523
